meanings.definition: A type of open-toed sandal with a flat sole.
meanings.sent1: I wore my flipflops to the beach.
meanings.sent2: She slipped on her flipflops before heading out.
meanings.sent3: The flipflops danced in the wind as if they had a life of their own.
meanings.sent4: Her flipflops whispered against the sandy shore.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flipflops brightened up the dull pavement.

meanings.definition: To change direction suddenly or unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: The car had to flipflops to avoid the obstacle.
meanings.sent2: He flipflops his decision at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The plot of the movie seemed to flipflops every few minutes.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions flipflopped between joy and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The weather flipflopped from sunny to stormy in an instant.

meanings.definition: To make a quick decision or change in opinion.
meanings.sent1: She tends to flipflops when under pressure.
meanings.sent2: He flipflops between two choices constantly.
meanings.sent3: The politician's flipflopping on the issue confused many voters.
meanings.sent4: His mind flipflopped back and forth, unable to settle on a single idea.
meanings.sent5: The student flipflopped on which topic to choose for the presentation.
